text: on tap pours orange thin white cap grass and citrus aroma sweet malt and bitter hops in taste

Draught at the Town Hall Brewery, Minneapolis, MN.
Clear bright golden color with a small white head. 
Deep hops, sweetness, malt and sugar in the aroma. 
Dark hops, moderate bitterness and sweet caramel malt. 
A bit too sweet for my enjoyment. Balanced though.

Bitter citrus fruits, grapefruit, some pine, light tropical fruits, passion fruit. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium sweet. Intense bittersweet orange, grapefruit, lively carbonation, bitter and dry finish, medium bodied. Very nice IPA, great palate. Keg at the brewey, Minneapolis.

16 ounce sample on tap at the brewpub. The aroma has some sweet, floral and pine hop character. Light dank. Quaffable. Transparent ruddy copper body with a medium, creamy off white head present. Starts with some mild to moderate pine hop resins. Moderate bitterness. Some chewy caramel tannic maltiness comes through in the middle with a mild toffee flavor. Finishes mildly bitter. Another well-balanced, killer IPA.

Clear golden, almost bronze pour with a single finger head. Light aroma, hard to pick up on anything. Taste is full of two row malt with some grass. Dry finish with lingering bitterness. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

On draft at Town Hall Brewery on quick trip to Minneapolis. Very drinkable. Pours clear copper color with lasting small white head. Good lacing retention. Not hugely aromatic but good faint hoppy smell to it. Crisp bitter finish. Good beer. Wish it was easier to find. Great food at the brewery too.
Small growler. Thanks Jesse! Pours a nice copper with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is grapefruit, tropical, pine, and malt. Well made and tasty IPA.

From tap at Town Hall Tap: pours light copper clear. Small white head. Nose is fresh but more of a crispy than fruity nose. Also caramel, mineral-malty if that makes sense.. Nice Ballance of hops and mineral malt... The aftertaste is fruitier, leading toa bitter finnish. Highly drinkable.

On tap at the brewery pours translucent copper, thin off white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is slight lemon Zest. Taste follows with moderate bitterness. More citrus zest in the mouth. Finish is abrupt, medium body.

Growler, big thanks to Jack. It pours clear dark amber with a decent yellow - white head. The nose is fresh, piney, caramel, varnish, juicy peach, stewed orange and pumpkin pie. The taste is bitter - sweet, decent malt back-bone, caramel, pine, varnish, earth, peppery, peach, resin and brown bread with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Good old-skool malty IPA.
Way too hoppy, with hardly anything else for balance. Super bitter aftertaste, really not very pleasant. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

IPA.   
強めの味、苦&

Poured from a growler into a standard pint glass

Growler opened with a satisfying burst of carbonation.

Pours a beautiful copper color with a thin 1/2" white head. Crystal clear with appropriate level of carbonation.  Good balance of earthy hops and sweet malt in the aroma. Nothing overpowering - just a really nice balance.  I expected this to be a little more hop forward, but this wasnt at all disappointing. Flavor has a good amount of bitterness, and a nice balance of fruity malt. When first poured, I detected a slight bubble gum flavor that was interesting and not unappealing. As the beer warmed in the glass a little, this disappeared.  Solid body, maybe slightly on the thin side, but appropriate for an IPA.  Extremely drinkable. I could have these all night long. Nothing is overpowering here - alcohol is detectable, but restrained. Malt and hops in perfect balance.  Balance is the key word for this beer. Not a hop monster of an ipa, just a really solid, malty, hoppy ipa that is worthy of the hype.

Keg @ Town Hall. Amber with a tight white head. Pine cone, tangerine. Summery fruits. Some biscuit. Taste is pretty bitter. Plenty of pine, PNW hopppiness. Lemon zest. Dirt covered Pear. Biscuity malt. Medium body, a touch oily. Fun.
Growler thanks to Eric. Pours a dark copper with small frothy off white head. The aroma is floral and pine. Medium mouth, sweet malt, nice hop bite, very good.

Clear copper pour with a thin off white head .... Aroma of piney hops, citrusy, grapefruity and caramel malts .... Taste is of piney hops, grapefruits, rindy, orange with a nice caramel malt backbone and a bitter ibu punch of hops.... Finish is dry and bitter with a lingering piney rindy hop bite ..... Mouthfeel is a little slick .... Solid above average IPA

On tap at the Brewery. Pour is clear orange with a big white head and sticky lacing. Orange peel, candied fruits, grapefruits, some bread, light grass, and lemon peel in the aroma. Taste is grapefruit peel, sweet malty, candied grapefruit, some bread, grass, and weed with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Pint on tap at brewery. Minneapolis. 

Pours transparent copper in color. Small head with decent lacing. 

Aroma is spicy and hoppy. Resin. Biscuity. 

Taste is medium bitter. 

Palate is medium body. Medium finish. Pretty decent.

Growler. Amber pour with a big off white head. Herbal/floral hop aromas. Herbal almost medicinal hop notes dominate. It has that eucalyptus/woody characteristic that for me is off putting. A bit unbalanced with an underwhelming malt backbone. Average mouthfeel.
On tap at the Brewery/Brewpub -- My second favorite of the flight. Very solid offering, but nothing spectacular. Balanced between early bittering hops and later aroma/flavor hops.
Draft sampler pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of caramel, floral, herbs and citrus. Taste is malts, grains and citrus.

Tap @ Town Hall: Bright, nearly clear copper with a foamy gray & beige tinted head that sits thinly on top of the vibrant brew. Aroma has heavy floral notes, grapefruit rind, citrus, herbal white pepper, hints of perfume, a touch of toasty caramel malt, baked biscuits, faint perfume, & even a spike of dank pot in the back-end. Smooth as hell on the palate... Herbal with big notes flowers & mild grassiness. White pepper coated, semi-candied grapefruit peel, faintly toasted cracker malts with only a slight hint of caramel. Moderately earth, more citric towards the finish with some of the rind-like bitterness that entwines & lingers with the leafy, floral hops. This ones a beauty, very well done.
On tap at Town Hall Brewery. Poured gold with white head. Aroma is grassy citrus funk. Light carb med bod. Tastes light bitter resinous.

This one has been on the list for a long time so thanks to the first sunday tasting for hooking it up. The hop aroma seems a little faint but the flavor is still there. Might have something to do with the growler travelling? Spicey peppery flavors. Little bit of a citrus bite. Thougth this was actually a rye ipa with as spicey as it was.

Part of a flight at the taproom. Pretty excited to finally try this one. Pours a clear reddish orange with a white head. An absolute citrus bomb. Orange, grapefruit, mango. Bittersweet finish. This beer is as good as advertised.

Draft at the brewery. This is a westie all the way. Theres a big perfumed aroma. This drinks like a big hoppy Miley Cyrus twerk ... like Sierra Nevada Pale Ale on roids. Only hit is in the body, just a bit thinner than most big beers. (#5706, 8/31/2014)

Growler from the source shared with ck1. Pours orangey-amber with a spongey off-white head. Nice streaky lace. Aroma has citrus and pine, with some fresh fruit and caramel. Taste is of bitter grapefruit.spucy pine and some resin, with a malt backbone for balance. Medium bodied with some alcohol. Finishes nicely blended between bitter and sweet, and very fruity. Nice in the sample. More bitter - less fruity - in the growler than memory (older in the growler?). A very nice brew! 15.2

On tap at Town Hall. Pours a clear caramel orange color with slight edge head. Aroma is hop bitterness in the form of tropical fruit and grapefruit acidity. Flavor is same with a creamy orange citrus sweetness reminiscent of Mad Foxs IPA. Medium bodied, active carbonation, orange zest finish.

Flight at town hall. Clear amber, white head, some lacing. Aroma: some caramel, some skunk, some pine, some grapefruit, but not a strong pull any direction. Taste: lightly sweet up front, but reasonably dry. Bitter finish with alcohol noticeable. Medium body, oily texture. Overall: a nice middle of the road ipa.

Up among the best. Pour was golden with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and pine and floral. Flavor followed some fruitiness overall under it, just lovely. Mouthfeel was moderate to full. Excellent stuff.

Tap - fair size foamy head, clear dark copper color, very nice citrus/grapefruit hop aroma and flavor, decent sweet malt backbone, very good overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice dark golden orange with a medium white head. Smells of hops up front and a hint of citrus. Taste is a great balance of hops, malts, caramel and a crisp citrus finish. Great palate that has a great malt and hop balance. Citrus hints and a slightly bitter finish. Nice beer from a small local brewer.

Pours a clear amber with good head and lacing. Aroma is fresh pine, clean and floral. Taste is spicy citrus in the finish, staying flavorful but not overly bitter. Id like to expound further, but MNs ridiculous liquor laws prevented me from taking home a growler after 10pm.

Pours a crisp golden orange color with a medium white head. Aroma is sweet malts, grapefruit, piney hops, and some floral overtones. Taste has good carbonation and mouthfeel. Nice clean citrus piney hop flavor. Great IPA but I feel it is overhyped.

(growler) Was intending to grab a growler of Petunias but ran into a clusterfrack at the brewpub and was notified all Petunias growlers were gone, so I went with this instead. Made a masala earlier today, so found it fitting. Pours a semi-hazy copper color with a good sized white head, that in typical Town Hall fashion, leaves a ton of lacing on the glass. Aroma is awfully subdued, with some glimmers of orange, fresh ground chile (the fruitiness, sans the pungency) and herbs (mostly mint). Flavor holds a good amount of biscuit, some caramel, powdered Tang, and towards the finish becomes a bit crackery with a solid amount of piney/ tea-like astringency carrying on well after drinking.

Pours a clear orange/amber with a 2 finger creamy sticky head.

A bit of malty sweetness with heavy citrus/floral tones to the aroma.

A bit of citrus up front with some sweet caramel. Rounds into a dry mix of pine and floral leaving the tongue coated in bitterness.

Fairly creamy with good carbonation levels.

Very good IPA, but falls just short of world class for me. Still going to enjoy drinking the rest of the growler.

Growler. Pour is clear amber/orange with nice ivory head and lots of lacing. Aroma has grapefruits, orange peel, lots of caramel. Taste is relatively sweet with some citrus, caramel, light berries. Medium-low body and ok carbonation. Too much caramel for me. Still enjoyable.
Draft at townhall. From notes. Loads of citrus and grapefruit. Super long finish. Awesome.

brewery pour...not my first experience with this brew, but first time getting down to rating it. solid orange pour with a white head that leaves good lacing. aroma is very clean hops...mainly citrus with some malt in the background. flavor is lots of citrus hop, but with some good sweetness to keep things swaying back and forth. hints of spice, but the Amarillo hops really shine IMO. resinous on the palate, the sticky feel to this beer really works, as it ends with a strong bitter note. great beer overall.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 Tasted on tap at Town Hall Brewery. Clear orange color with a frothy off white head. Bold fruit & hop aroma. Crisp with a bit of bite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had it on tap at Town Hall Brewery in Minneapolis! Damn thats a good beer!! Poured a clear amber hue with a light head and uneven lacing. The aroma subtly tickles the nostrils with hop sweetness, and notes of citrus. The taste is a sturdy IPA with a solid citrus aftershock!!,

A delightfully fully hopped IPA with an intense spicy finish that is balanced well by this brews bitterness. Has an intense floral/citrus aroma that really navigates this beers experience. Very pleasant.

Great example of the style. Fresh, piney hops at the front, not over-malted, finishes clean and warm with just the right amount of bitterness. On tap at the town hall brewery in Minneapolis. Havent tried the Streamliner.
Sweet Mango, Citrus Hops, Spices, and Yeast notes. Very smooth and lightweight IPA and easy to drink
Nice part of the house sampler. Really enjoyed this great brew! It has great citrus hoppyness and a nice dry bitterness.

It pours a crystal clear dull amber-golden color with a stubborn eggshell colored head. This is a nice-looking beer. The nose is right in my wheel house. A lot of grapefruit and a few notes of toasted malt popping through sporadically. Big, full mouthfeel with a light carbonation, but some hop warmth to pick up for the carbonation to create that finishing burn. Pine flavors are prevalent. Grapefruit forward, with a peculiar, but not unpleasant flavored medicine taste. Some dried apricot appearing right before the finish. I also noted some allspice on a couple of occasions. Plenty of resiny bitterness on the finish. I really like it a lot. My first experience with Minneapolis Town Hall. Well done.
On tap at Town Hall. Pours a clear copper color with white head. Citrus, resiny, piney flavors. Good IPA.

Growler sent from mista (thanks a lot, Geoff), pours a beautiful, fairly clear, red-tinted amber (sort of like a rosé), with a medium white head. Nose bursts of rich resinous hops, fresh pine tree, coniferous, and a dry bready caramel malt backing - smells delectable. The flavour is very dry and foresty, with coniferous and pine trees, dry earthy hops, and a dry biscuity malt backing. Highly drinkable, with a very dry palate. An excellent IPA.
Tap at brewery.  Pours orange with nice hop aroma. Flavor is terrific citrusy and floral hops with a nice bitterness. Fantastic IPA
On tap at the brewery.  Sweet floral, pine, tangerine upfront.. fresh and juicy.  Finish is bitter, but extremely well balanced. delicious ipa.. Could drink a lot of these.
On tap at this good old West Bank brewpub.  Aromas abound here and the subtle additions make this beer a local favorite.
Grapefruit nose. Sweet and bitter malt. Smooth flavor with long finish. Real nice balanced beer.
growler. Pours clear orange with frothy head. Aroma if juicy hops and and grapefruit. Taste is nice balance of sweet and hop bitter

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2013 Growler - provided by Huhzubendah. Thanks! Poured a clear copper color, with a medium sized white head. Lot of citrus hops in this one! Light and enjoyable, this was pretty darn good. Highly drinkable.

64 oz. growler served in a CBS snifter. Huge thanks to supercolter for the growler. Thanks Jeff!

A: Pours a clear ruby color with a tooth colored head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to a thin cap and thicker ring. Sticky, splotchy lace.

S: Nice citrus hop profile up front. Some orange marmalade sweetness with lemon sorbet. Lime zest with a pronounced piney bitterness on the finish. Sugar cookie malt backbone.

T: Lemony citrus with a hint of red apple sweetness. A little pear with some candied limes and a little honey. Same cookie malts provide a nice sweet balance to it. Less bitter than the nose, but it adds a touch of piney flavors that that compliment the sweetness.

M: Light bodied with a medium carbonation level. Hop oils leave themselves across the palate for a great finish. Clean, but flavorful.

O: Worth the wait. Very drinkable with a great flavor profile. Time to bring on Mango Mama!

Serving type: growler
Pours a clear golden. Sweet strawberry aromas with hops. Flavours are fruity and malty with a very hoppy finish. Great!

Received this growler from skipanoka2, thanks a lot man Ive wanted to try this for years. Split this three ways so I had a good 21 ounces of this stuff. Color is dark orange and the head is billowing and huge, no lack of carbonation here. Smells like caramel and a bit of hops thrown in for good measure. The taste is really chewy caramel with a bit of pine and a very strong bitterness on the finish, very bitter. Overall I liked it.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 10-21-2011 15:44:16

Tap. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head and great lacing. Aroma is fairly weak, with notes of pine, spruce and citrus. Flavor is about the same, lightly sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium. Not bad, but I am not sure what all the fuss is about.

On tap as part of the sampler tray. Nice blend of hops and malt. Citrus notes. Very good 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Town Hall Brewery. Tried both cask and tap versions. Very good stinky, sweaty hop aroma. Pretty copper-orange color with a very creamy 1-2 cm. head. Good, fairly mild, hop initial; mid has some good malt, a bit of grapefruit and some other citrus; final contains a bit of pepper. Medium body. Well balanced and some good character.  Cask version 3.6 / Tap version 3.3

Growler pour into Duvel tulip, but I have had this every which way in the past.
Russet colored (wifes words, not mine) with big white head that lasts.  Big citrus aroma, some malty sweetness but mostly just the amazing hop aroma.  Flavor is fairly bitter to start with good hop flavors, malty in the middle and then a smooth hoppy finish.  Citrus and piney hops, delicious.  No complaints about the palate, thickness is good and the crisp carbonation enhances the wonderful hop flavors.
Full disclosure, this is a home review.  Ive been loving this beer since I turned 21 and it is absolutely fantastic.  If this beer were bottled I think it would be up there with Pliney and Heady.

Deep golden color, clear, little head, no lacing. Interesting blend of grain and hops on the nose. A little surprised at the flavor - bad keg? - but there is a heavy grain flavor that frankly overwhelms the ipa characteristics. Anyway, hop bitterness on the finish. Overall an ok beer but Im a little thrown relative to my west coast ipa experiences.

On tap at brewpub pours a clear copper with a small off-white head. Aroma of sweet tropical fruits, citrus, resinous hops, and a caramel malt. Taste of resinous sticky pine, tropical, citrus, and nice bitterness all around. Delicious and easy drinking!

Matt is turning out to be the growler king. He brought this over to my place a few weeks ago. Review from notes.

A: The beer appears amber/orange, has a decent sized head, and leaves a fair amount of lacing on the glass. It is pretty clear with good effervescence. It looks like it survived the trip.

S: The smell is really fantastic. Fresh hops and citrus.

T: This is a great tasting beer, and really easy to drink. The citrus flavors come forth quite nicely, with a pleasant bitterness in the back of each sip. Yum!

M: The feel is very smooth. A great bitter finish with no astringency.

D: O ya, I could drink a bunch of this. Well worth seeking out. This is one of my favorite IPAs now.

Fabulous beer! Served at a nice temperatue with giant, foamy, frothy, light tan head as I asked for and which lasted for a very long time and lots of lace. Color was an amber copper with some bubble trails. Aroma was hop, malt, toffee, spice and fruit. Flavors like nose plus was fairly dry up front but yielded to some surggar later and balanced very well with carbonic tang and bitter. Body was exellent; ditto carbonation. Finish is like flavor, of average length, and is supremely drinkable.

From growler, poured to imperial Surly pint glass. Brewed three days ago, bottled a few hours ago:

Pours a dark gold, pushing crimson. Clear as a bell, slow and steady beading. A sweet sticky head leaves behind all sorts of lacing.

Prickly pine, resinous, nectarine, citrus syrups, some darker creamy malts keep things in balance. This beers got quite a nose on it.

Smooth on the tongue considering the strong coniferous element. Orange peel bitterness, aggressive hop presence that somehow manages to avoid hindering the overall drinkability. Delicious. The body is a bit thin but that doesnt take much away from an otherwise spectacular beer.

If youre ever in Minneapolis, most definitely try this one out.

Hamilton23 shared his Growler received by a good trader.  Nice darker maple orange pour with decent head and nice cling.  Nose is hops and citrus.  Taste follows the nose and has a real nice malt backbone.  This is listed as a single IPA at 6% but has the balls of a double.  As a single I am not sure I have had better (and I live in San Diego).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from a nice trader.  Pours a rich copper color with a fair amount of creamy white head with loads of lacing.  Aroma is floral hops and a touch of citrus.  Good amount of bitterness balanced with a nice malt backbone.  Really tasty stuff.

Utter deliciousness.  Went to Minnesota for a doctors appointment, and, lo and behold, thirteen feet from my hotel is Town Hall brewery.  The beer gods smiled upon me on this trip.  Masala mama is a beautiful IPA, piney but with a huge swath of grapefruit and orange, with a lovely green herbal fade.  The malts give the beer a nice comfy padding that keeps the IBUs from ruining the party, yet the hops are still given plenty of space to party down.  The texture is scary smooth, meaning the pint disappears startlingly quick.  World class IPA, and the flat iron steak at the restaurant is pretty damn good as well.

Poured in to my surly pint glass out of my growler. Pours a bright amber with a two finger head. Aroma of hops and almost a butterscotch malty note. Taste follows the nose very tasty and smooth. If I lived in MN this would be my go-to beer!
Hazy amber with an average off-white head. Aroma is of toffee, caramel, citrus, mango, pineapple, and floral. Taste is of citrus, caramel, grass, and tropical fruit.

Growler from Mike. The beer is copper colored, beige colored head, and clear. The smell is tropical fruit aromas, papya, hops, pepper, spicy, and good. The taste is a good smooth bitterness, fruits, lot of fruits, hops, and good.

On tap @ the brewery.
Bright amber brew with lots of sticky white head.  I had this on tap and cask, side by side, and the cask version had a head that lasted forever.  Aromas of bready malt, citrus, and pine.  Flavors of grapefruit and pine with a nice malt backbone making this quite balanced.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2012 Growler thanks to mtjoseph during Free Beer Week!  Thanks!  Copper looking pour with minimal head. Aroma is a nice mix of grass and tropical hops. Flavor is nice and hoppy but odd. There is grain and soap and very English like hops. Its ok but nothing like Id hoped. Medium body with a soft round mouthfeel.
Thanks SJ.  For a regular IPA (Not Imperial) The aroma is a full floral and citrus blast.  A nice mild caramel and pine flavor that finishes sweet and with notes of hop cone bitterness.

From notes.  First reviewed 6/21/2010.  Poured 6/19 from a growler filled on 6/17 into a pint glass.

Masala Mama has a very dark appearance for an IPA, a dark copper color with a fluffy off-white head. Good head retention, and nice sticky lace is all over the glass.

The aroma is hoppy, but less than I would have expected. Earthy and pine notes predominate, but there are citrus notes as well. The malt aroma is bready.

The flavor is very balanced, but I felt it was missing something. The bready malt was soft, the pine and earthy hops were subtle. The grapefruit flavor was really the only flavor to push through strongly. Finished mildly bitter.

It has a pleasantly creamy feel, with slightly above average carbonation. Not much residue remains from the hop oil.

This was a quaffable brew with a nice smoothness, but there was nothing that really catapulted this over the top. Although I am glad I was fortunate enough to try it, I will not go crazy to seek it out again.

Poured on tap at Town Hall Brewery into a pint glass.

A.  1.5 finger thick head, golden red hue, soft for ring ever after sitting

S.  Smells sweet, grape fruit, pine and lots of citrus

T.  The tastes is sweet, slightly bready, a tiny bit bitter like grapefruit, and a little bit tart.  Light pine overtone.

M.  Medium body, mildly chewy with a very wet finish.  Very easy to drink

O.  This is a great beer.  A go-to anytime IPA for me.  I could drink this every weekend.  Wait!  I do!  Great flavor and easy to drink keeps you coming back for more

On cask.   Clear copper with a thick white head that lasts. Up front hop aroma, citrus, sweet, hidden freshly ground 2row malt aroma. Pine/resin flavor up front, slightly grassy too, lightly sweet, needs more malt for balance  Medium body, strong hop bitter finish, too bitter. This is a good double IPA, not IPA
Pretty good stuff.  Aroma is big orange citrus with a good amount of piney kick.  Taste is light citrus and pungeant resiny pine.  Finish is harshly bitter but still enjoyable.
Growler thanks to mattyb83. Smells just like ballast Point sculpin. Swee malty body with a big bitter finish. Kick ass.

Growler received in trade from phisigben, thanks for the opportunity. Shared after a long day with HopasaurusRex. Pours a deep golden color with a decent bubbly white head that displays moderate retention and lace. Smells fantastic. Floral, pine, citrus and tropical fruity hops with hints of sweet bready malt deep underneath. Taste is resinous, fruity, pine, and citrus hops with a bit of sweet bready almost caramel malt. Fairly dry with a medium to light body. Moderate level of carbonation with a resinous mouthfeel. Nice flavorful hopification of a beer. If I lived in MN I would drink this all the time, but since I dont Im glad I got to try it.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2012 On tap at town hall, aroma is nice and hoppy but taste is just average finish is nice and crisp but this is just a good IPA not great iMO

Sampled a 2nd time.. Still grainy and malty with a malty back almost too much

Sampled 3rd time: This batch was much better, not malty at all, straight forward and perfectly carbed. would go 3.7 for rating.

Sampler at the brewpub.  It poured a dark golden amber color with a  white head. The aroma was of crisp fresh hops, citrus, and a little pine. The flavor was hoppy and a very decent amount of hops. Very decent IPA.

On draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear, amber color with a white head and some lacing. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, grapefruit. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is malty sweet, cereal, bread, which quickly fades to pine hops, with a nice bitter hop finish. Excellent.
On tap at Town Hall. A great IPA. Bright and lively citrus aroma. Not killer bitter like some IPAs, but nicely balanced.

Date: November 12, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Town Hall Taps
Translucent gold, slight head and lacing, hoppy aroma.  Taste was well balanced with malts and had a slight bitter finish.

Thanks to bobbypaulson for the growler. I had never even heard of this before he offered.

Good bitter, citrus-y aroma. Fantastic appearance: thick, dark amber color with a big head. Taste is maybe a touch too bitter, but still pleasantly rich. Overall, this lies somewhere between very good and great. Definitely no problem finishing off the growler with my wife.

On tap at Town Hall.  Reddish amber with a thin tan head.  Aroma is floral and citrusy with grapefruit, light pine and some caramel.  Tastes of citrus, grapefruit, light pine, grains and sweet malt.  Finishes up somewhat bitter, though perhaps that taste is in my mouth since that punk Nyjer Morgan just won the NLDS for the Milwaukee Brewers.

clear Copper with impressive lacing.  The smell is quite complec and its most unique aspect.  Pine, herbal, spice, tropical fruit, malt.  The flavor is sweet, spicy, and a sharp bitterness with dimension.  Feels lightly surprisingly light bodied though with a puckering numb bitter finish.  Slightly surprised at the perfect ranking but it isnt your average by any means.

Growler courtesy of dougofthefuture.  Thanks Doug.  Pours a reddish amber with a finger tall white head that has good retention and lacing.  The aroma is bready malt, biscuit, a lot of mango, and a bit of pine.  The taste is sweet bready malt, some biscuit, a bit of pine, with mango flavors coming in late.  Nowhere near as much mango as in the aroma.  The finish is bready with a decent bitterness.  Light bodied and very drinkable.  Medium-low carbonation.  I really enjoyed the mouthfeel.  Not the best IPA I have had, but quite good.  Definitely one of the better malt forward IPAs.  The aroma is quite awesome, but the taste is slightly disappointing.

This is another beer tasted at the Taproom in minneapolis.  The IPA was the second beer enjoyed at this neighborhood taproom.  This was served in 14 oz glass.  The color was clearer than the Pale Ale.The clear light amber and multiple hops was a special ale.  The floral tastes of citrus and spruce was present.  The medium body ale had  balanced carbonation with a creamy texture.  The finish was smooth with nice bitterness to enjoy.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2014 A: Rich amber body capped by millions of tiny bubbles forming a fluffy head... great retention and thorough lacing.

S: Subdued citrus hops, with piney and floral notes. Soft malt, caramel backbone

T: A more intense representation of the nose... light citrus, pine and floral hop bitterness. well balanced with the slightly sweet caramel malt backbone

M: Smooth, refreshing, crisp clean bitter finish.

O: To be honest I wasnt "blown away" with the flavor or the nose. very good, sure. the true gem of this beer though is the easy drinking experience. this is the kind of ipa you want when chilling on your deck on a nice summer day. goes back like water, but with a hell of a lot more flavor :)
A phenomenal IPA.  Just the right amount of hops in conjunction with a nice maltiness that subtlety shows itself.

copper pour
very nice apricot fruitiness, pine and caramel aroma.
Flavour was piney  herbal,  citrusy, medium malt sweetness. Nice balanced finish. Cant believe its taken me this long to try it!

Growler from Bobbypaulson. Pours amber with areally nice biege head. I soon as I cracked the growler the scent of pine erupted from it, in the tulip I smell pine, grapefruit, mango, caramel, orange and some grass. I taste grapefruit, pine resin, mango, caramel, and a awesome bitter hop presences. Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is very long and juicy pine hop bitterness. Very nice IPA.

Pours a clear amber with a nice bright white head.  Smells of overly sweet and rich caramel malts with a nice piney backbone.  Just a really nice sweet and heavy caramel aroma to this.  Mouthfeel is a bit lively on the tongue with a nice sweet grapefruit and citrus fruit flavor.  The caramel malts really come through and provide a nice back drop to the bitter hops.  A touch of earth to it as well.  Nice and bitter on the backend that delivers for a long time in the finish.  This wants to be a DIPA but its a bit too thin for that.  Besides, its an IPA anyways, so the body is pretty spot on.

Growler.  Amber color with a one finger off-white head on top.  Fresh cut grass and floral aroma with pine, lemon, and caramel.  Theres plenty of malty sweetness in the flavor, perhaps more than expected based on the aroma, showing as sweet caramel and bread.  The hops are assertive and do a good job taking over mid palate leading to a very nice lengthy dry finish with ample bitterness.  This is just a flat out solid IPA with excellent drinkability.  Big thanks to whoever sent this to me for Secret Santa Summer 11 as this is one Ive wanted to try for quite some time now.

Tasted on 7/5/11 from a growler sent to me in a trade, thank you to Mark.  Pours clear fiery red amber with an average off-white head that slowly recedes to spotty lacing.  The nose is herbal, citrus, and resin hops along with lightly sweet caramel malt and a very light hint of cinnamon and baking spices.  The flavor is a very balanced blend of herbal, citrus, and resin bitter hops and lightly sweet caramel malt and light touches of cinnamon and vanilla.  The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long bitter citrus and resin hops finish.

on tap at the brewery, pours light amber with a medium off white head.  Aroma is a big hop bouquet of pine, pineapple and tropical fruits, dank grassy notes and light toast.  Flavor is light toast and nuts ending super dry with again very pine, dank and grassy hops.  Really nice IPA that is so freaking dry in the finish you just have to keep drinking.
Poured a nice golden color and had minimal head. It has a very refreshing sweet and bitterness taste.

Growler shared at CCB. Pours a golden/orange with a medium white head. Aroma is hops, grapefruit, and caramel. Flavor is grassy hops, grapefruit, bread, and lemon. Medium bodied. This beer doesnt try to be anything more than an awesome IPA...and thats probably why its really good.

Growler thrown in as an EXTRA by 	mattyb83, thanks a TON Matt!  Pours a very deep and dark amber with an impressive 1/2" thick tan head from a week old growler.  This thing would stay carbonated in that growler for a month!  Aroma is of deep malt but a nice hop bouquet to let you know this is a serious IPA.  The taste is a lot more malt forward than I was expecting but the hops do a great job of letting you know this is how the brewer intended it to be, not an old IPA.  The middle and finish on this are very, very nice and make me come back to it.  The initial malt not as much.  Overall this is a fine beer that lends itself very well to tap and growler only.  Not sure that I would like this one from a bottle.  Still a nice IPA that I can fully understand being a top of the line in its class.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: growler, thanks to exiled, copper colored pour with thick foam, grapefruit and metallic aroma, flavors of bready grapefruit, bitter and dry finish

(Growler thanks to DalzAle at GABF party downstairs at Falling Rock) clear amber with fine white bubbles. Nose of mango, grapefruit, bitter and hoppy some cream in the aroma as well. Taste of biscuit, bitter, oily citrus, and grapefruit. Didnt live up to the hype for me.

Big thanks to Exiled for sharing this growler. This has been on my wants for a long time.

The beer pours an orange-amber color with a white head. The aroma is heavy on the candy hops, orange citrus, pine and biscuit malt. A very well balanced smelling IPA.

The flavor is similar, but not quite as good as the aroma. I get a lot of orange and brown sugar notes, as well as some toffee. Low to medium bitterness.

Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Glad I got to try this one.

Growler.  Clear amber orange pour, lasting carbonation and a slightly sweet orange hop aroma.  Flavor is a good marmalade and malt base, mellow fruit and slightly biting hops and finished with a nice bitter aftertaste.  Cant believe I hadnt rated this one until now!

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2012 On tap at MTHB. Darkish burnt orange appearance with a white head. Somewhat subdued piney hoppy nose. Grapefruity, bushy hoppy flavor and bitter aftertaste. Pretty tasty beer but nothing elite about it.

This beer is really hit and miss. First time I had it in a growler awesome. On tap and cask at the pub, so-so.  The score reflects having on tap. 

It pours a very dark orange with a big white. There is great lacing and it is surprisngly clear for its darkness of color.

The aroma is nice and subtle. Orange zest hits on the front end but the hops are present. 

The tatse is complex with a nice sweet start, hops are present always and really show them self on the end. Its a nice bitter finish but not to bitter so it allows for big swigs and heavy drinking.

The feel is great, lasts several seconds, the hops stay even after you swallow.
On Tap. Classic interpretation of the style, not ultra bitter, good fruity notes, great pine flavor.

From notes:

Growler received in a past trade with a generous MN guy. Shared with kubrick215 and a non-BA friend.

Pours a hazy dark golden orange with burnt orange hues when held to a light and a two finger frothy, pillowy off-white head. Excellent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap that coats the glass with rings, streaks and splotches of soapy lacing.

As soon as the growler was opened you could smell the dank, resinous oily hops from across the room. Very earthy and floral with a lots of pine and sticky kind bud character dominating the nose. Theres also a good amount of sweet citrus and tropical fruit. Hints of pineapple, mango, grapefruit and citrus rind. Subtle malts with hints of sweet alcohol and biscuit.

Chewy full body with a blast of dry, bitter hops that linger throughout into a long, dry finish. More one-dimensional than the aroma suggests with an overpowering dry, earthy pine flavor. Slightly floral but mostly just intensely bitter and dry. Kind of like eating a tree. Resinous, sticky and oily with the dryness just coating the tongue in an unpleasant way. This really hurts the mouthfeel and drinkability. Not much in the way of sweetness to balance things out. The tropical and citrus fruit notes from the aroma are minimal if not completely absent. Its hard to pick anything else out underneath the dry, earthy pine needles. Faint malt backbone but again not enough to balance things out much. Subtle hits of caramel, biscuit and graham cracker.

Overall, Im happy I got to try this beer but it was just too one-dimensional for my liking. I love intense bitter hoppy beers but this beer coats the tongue in an unpleasant way and reminds we of having cotton mouth after smoking low grade weed back in college.

Sampled on tap at the brewpub (Minneapolis, MN). Pours a nice dark decent hazed amber, with a frothy soapy head. Aromas are some nice floral and citrusy hops, caramel and pale malts move in, bread. Sweetness tempers and impressive hop bouquet. Initial is medium bodied, grapefruit and lemon mix into caramel, toffee, bread. Doses of florals, grass, and touches of soap, pine. Moderate bitterness, fresh and vibrant, but not the most complex hopping. Bitter and dry linger, with crisp, sweet pale and caramel malts. Solid IPA, a bit less intense than I expected

Fresh growler via trade, thanks SourNotes!  Pours clear copper color with lively carbonation, and a fluffy off-white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, slight pineapple, caramel malt.  Taste is mildly sweet and nicely bitter, with a crisp dry finish.  Nice balance of citrusy hops and toasted caramel malt.  Very good IPA!
Great IPA!  Aromas of cut grass and citrusy hops.  Smooth citrusy hop flavors.  Overall a great IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2011 Draft. Poured into a big imperial pint glass @ Town Hall Tap a slightly hazed amber orange color wih a slight off white 1 finger head. The head is rather thick and leaves sticky lace on the glass. Aroma of sweet citrus rind hops. The taste is slightly sweet upfront that transitions to a long drawn out citric bitter hop flavor. Ends with a lingering bitterness. Medium mouthfeel. Super easy drinking. Zero alcohol notes. This is a pretty near perfect IPA for me being well balanced and easy drinking.

Growler from Mattyb83. Thanks buddy. Pours dark amber with off-white head. Aromas of pine, grapefruit, oranges, and caramel malts. Flavors of pine, grapefruit, caramel malts, and nice hop bitterness. Finishes nice and bitter. Mouthfeel is a fine but carbonation is near flat as this growler had to be close to freezing during shipping. Oh well still a damn good IPA.

Draft at Town Hall. Pours a very attractive deep gold with a fluffy and sticky offwhite head. Nose isnt what I was expecting. I get a ton of floral and piney hops. Really lacks the citrusy punch that I was expecting. Soft malty component in the background as well. On taste, very good bitterness across the palate, but again is lacking the citrusy component that would make this outstanding. Clean malts and more floral and pine. Meh.
Tap. Aroma of fruit, hops, and pine. Flavor is citrus and pine with a lot ofg hop flavor. Good brew but I have had better IPAs.

Growler thanks to Tharreld.  Pours a amber/orange color with a small white head. Nose is pine, citrus, nice hops and a touch of sweetness. Flavor is nice and crisp, citrus and fruit flavors with bitter hop flavor in the end. Nice dry finish and great balance between hops and sweetness. Good beer.

Poured into a pint glass. Big thanks to Buebie for this.

4.0 A: Nearly clear medium orange color. One and a half fingers of frothy, off-white head. Average retention, but lots of lacing.

4.0 S: Lots of piny-ness, but it is a "soft" piny-ness if that makes sense. Citrus is mainly mango and orange with perhaps a touch of grapefruit. Slightest amount of crystal malts.

4.5 T: Medium bitterness, but it is a very soft bitterness. Lots of citrus with orange and grapefruit most prominent. Tasty, hoppy. Crystal malt adds a touch of balance.

4.0 M: Lighter medium body. Good carbonation, especially for a growler. Creamy, but could be moreso. Touch of bitterness and pine on finish. Quite smooth.

4.5 D: Very tasty and clean enough to put a lot of these down (split the growler with one other BA, so I did just that).

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 06-16-2010 05:37:23

Growler from Joanna, thanks! Appearance is is amber and maybe just a slight haze (not filtered?) nice brown head and laces well. Aroma is caramelly malts, breads, and most of all, intense grapefruit, oranges, piney and almost woody, with other notes, of lemons grass, and resinous dank.  Taste is intense malt character but not sweet backed by extremely fresh citrus, resinous hops and has a nice blend of toasty, bready malts and fresh spruce, citrus, and resinous/piney hops.  Mouthfeel is thin and slick and no lingering sweetness but some bitterness.  I would almost call it oak aged but maybe its just the hop tannins and the freshness.  Very nice, glad to try.

DalzAle brought a growler of this to our QC tasting, cant thank him enough!  Pours a clear amber with a frothy white head, the aroma starts of with some piney hops with flowery notes in it, the flavor is well balanced with the hops and the malt, gooooooooood stuff.

12/23/10.  Huge thanks to DalzAle for this growler at the QC Christmas tasting!  Huge tropical fruits, pine, citrus, and a dash of caramel in the aroma.  Awesome sweet tropical fruits blended nicely with caramel and more.  Stellar.

Draft at Town Hall.  Rich hoppy aroma.  Nice hoppy taste followed by a solid sweet malt backbone.  Filtered orange-brown, foamy head that laces the glass.  Awesome display of hops while the body remains clean.  Exceptional balance.  World Class.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2012 Growler from Vince, thank you. There are light aromas of tangerine, mango, and citrus, with a bit of unique earthy maltiness, soft with no biite at all. The IPA pours dark amber with an awesome creamy big head. The flavors of a nice citrus light hopped India Pale Ale that settles smoothly, again with no bite. Settles very softly on the palate.

Nice mostly clear amber color with some a layer of sticky foam that leaves spotty lacing all around the glass.

Aroma is great - nice bitter hops. Flavor is similar, but somehow not quite as appealing as the smell - still very nice though.

Carbonation is right where youd expect and the resulting mouthfeel is pleasantly smooth - not too thick or thin.

This is a very tasty IPA, and something Id definitely drink again.

Serving type: growler

On tap at the brewpub. Lovely IPA. Very floral and resiny aroma. Hops are very fresh tasting in it, lots of the standard flavors, but very crisp and fresh. Dry bitter finish. Wish Id had time to sit and drink a few.

Growler from hellomynameis. Thanks Zac. Nose of fruity hops both citrus and tropical notes, floral and piney hops as well as a good deal of caramel malt sweetness. Pours hazy amber with a great creamy meringue like head and super sticky lace. A great looking beer. The flavor is full of hops, lots of citrus and tropical fruitys, floral and pines, strong caramel malt, somewhat sweet with some residual sugars as well. A touch of iced tea here and there, and that might be my only complaint. With such a great hop profile, a little less sweetness could be valuable in showcasing the awesomeness in the hops. Still very enjoyable.

Had on tap at the brewpub in August 2009. 

A: Poured a dark orange color with a good amount of off-white head.

S: Very, very nice--the nose has a lot of citrus hops with a little bit of a tropical background. Some caramel type malt in the background.

T: I agree with a few others that there might be a little too much malt here; Id like to be able to feel a little presence without tasting too much of it. Very, very tasty, but I wish the hops had the opportunity to shine a little bit more here.

M: Light to medium body with a good amount of carbonatino and not much alcohol kick.

D: Quite high. Would have liked to have pint after pint of this.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 09-24-2009

Growler from the brewpub. Aroma is strong and yeasty with a clean citrus with it. Very nice and bitter with an extremely lingering finish. Sweet caramel malt on the front end. Oily in the mouth. Very solid. Worth traveling to the brewpub to get.

Sample at Town Hall on 10/29/10. Clear copper pour with a medium off-white head. Orangy and piney hop nose with very little malt essence. Flavor is orange, grass and pine along with a bit of malt and a super bitter finish.

Growler pours a hazy, burnt orange with a frothy, off white head.  BIG aroma, hoppy, pine, citrus fruits, earthy, a little biscuit, orange scones.  Flavor is sweet, hoppy, lemon juice, orange rind, soapy, pine, caramel malts, light cracker.  Full bodied, bitter finish.  Smooth.
Growler. Huge aroma. Fruity, juicy hops. Copper with active carbonation toa  thin head. Great flavor. Medium bitterness with lots of fresh fruit. A smooth and well-balanced IPA.
Growler courtesy of tarheels86, thank you sir!  Dark golden color, small white head.  Intense grass aroma, nice taste, with aroma favored rather than bitterness.

Growler courtesy of beeranddogs. Pours a hazy reddish orange with a big yellow, creme head that has good lacing. Nose of red fruits, pineapple, unripe pear- overall dank tropical hops with a big malt presence. Taste is heavy, dry, bitter, cedar, woody, well-balanced. Pretty earthy but not piney or astringent.
Clear red orange pour with a thin light tan head.  Crispy piny hop aroma with onions and grass.  All bitter with grassy hops.  Earthy.  Overwhelming bitterness lasts.

Growler.  Pours clear orange with a medium, frothy white head, high retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (caramel, toast, bread), heavy hops (floral, pine, citrus), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of peach, pineapple, and alcohol - oh so fresh!  Flavor is heavy malt (caramel, toast, bread), heavy hops (floral, pine, citrus), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of peach, pineapple, and alcohol with a very fresh, leafy green hops character.  Full body, medium warmth and carbonation, low creaminess with a dry finish.

Orangish-copper pour with a big, loose, white head.  Loads of mango, melon and citrus in the aroma, with notes of yeast, toffee, lemon zest, and orange zest.  The flavor follows through from the aroma with lots more mango and melon dominating.  Theres a bit of resinous pine and a distinct dankness in there too.  There is also just some slight perceptible alcohol on the finish as well.  The body is medium-full and dry with soft carbonation.

Growler shared by Doug, thanks 
Appearance: Clear dark amber with a medium sized off-white head and some lacing left in the glass 
Aroma: Floral, bisquity and citrus 
Taste: Floral and grapefruit 
A nice IPA, clean, crisp and easy to drink

Growler thanks to Kevin. Pours a light brown/red color with a medium off-white colored head. A sweet citrus and biscuit nose. The flavor is a very nice smooth citrus hop, rich and malty. Very light bitterness. Enjoyable.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear copper colored body with a thin, creamy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma has lots of juicy pines, florals, and tropical fruits with some citrus and resins. Nice caramel backing with a moderate sweetness. Flavor is similar. Balanced caramel malts and a medium-high piney and grassy citrus. Mangos and florals grow in the finish along with the hops giving this a pretty high bitterness level. Dry with a lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and a light carbonation. Overall, a nice IPA. Lots of hops with a solid malt backing to balance.

Pours a deep red with a great head, great retention, and plenty of lace. The aroma has lots of floral with a fruity maltiness in the background and a bit of onion-y hops. The flavor has a great grapefruit character with some herbal and citrus hoppiness. The beer is nicely dry and plenty bitter, a top class IPA in all regards.

Growler. Pour is awesome copper red with solid tight head that dissipates to a film. Aroma is vibrant spruce and pine with subtle citrus and malt. Taste is again strong pine a nd citrus with malt and a lingering spice in the end. Palate is sticky and slick all at the same with a nice dry finish. Amazing!

Growler pour at RBSG. Pours clear amber, thin skim, surprising lacing for a growler! Nose is lemon, spice, yeast, pine, grapefruit. Flavours of spicy lemons, rich malt. really wonderfully balanced. Kickass.

Taste thanks to Sara!Dark, transparent ruby body, foamy white head. Dank, earthy nose, some caramel malt in a nice, un-sweet balance. Flavor is similar, more malt than the nose but with considerable bitterness in the finish, also some pine and more caramel. Very thick, creamy body. A nice blend overall, though more herbal than fresh and fruity, and as such, a bit bitter. Actually like Nugget Nectar except for less balance and freshness.

A-pours a brilliant glowing reddish copper color liquid that has a nice op haze. the head is thick, pillowy, off white in color. Lots of head from an aggressive pour that has huge retention and sticks all over the glass. Looks so good!

S-the nose is big and hoppy, good caramel malt with floral notes hitting the nose hard, extremely oily and juicy, tons of grapefruit take over and dont quit with plenty of pine to accompany. Big time single IPA, very impressive nose!

T-the taste is big, thick and syrupy. floral esters are light but present, strong caramel malt to balance the huge hop presence, grapefruit comes in hard and the taste is quite big. A big time oily hop flavor, hints oily pine, more grapefruit bitterness at the finish that doesnt linger at all. this is a hop-a-rific beer!

M-smooth and creamy, full to medium body. wow is this thick and syrupy, creamy but smooth. Light carbonation, crisp finish but not biting at all. it is wet and juicy throughout coating the mouth completely.

D-this is an exceptional beer, notes of balance with big time hop flavors, great mouthfeel, easy drinking. This would rival most double IPAs for supremecy, gives the feel of a pliny, right up there with anything else, the only thing that keeps it from the perfect score is the huge oily hops that do seem to stick a little.

Two pints on cask at the brewpub.  Amber brown with a frothy head and nice lacing all over the glass.  Complex bouquet of floral aroma and earthiness.  Amazing mouthfeel on the cask version.  I sampled the tap version, which was also good.  These pints went down fast and easy.  A hugely rich flavor with a good bit of maltiness but with a large balancing hop presence...largely floral hops with a touch of fruit and some earthiness.  Extremely bitter but the most unharsh bitterness you can imagine.  The regular version had stronger flavors, but less silky in the mouthfeel...definitely excellent, but I slightly prefer the cask version.

Via trade with KButler1.  Nice citrus, peach, caramel aroma.  Everything in good balance.  The appearance is somewhat clear, ruby red, white head.  The flavor is caramel, citrus, pine.  The finish is mainly piney hops.  The body is medium/thick, slick in mouthfeel.  Excellently crafted, a winner.  Thanks, Kevin.

Pours copper with a small white frothy head.  Aroma of bread, grassy hops, and slight citrus.  Flavor is bitter up front with some bubble gum-like sweetness.  Grapefruit, some pine, and bubble gummy flavors.  Not bad, but it just isnt for me.

A decent offering, well worth the money and id definitely get it again. Just didnt knock my socks off. The hops were completely lacking the citrus and pine expected, but there was a huge spicy earthy hop flavor and aroma that was quite unique and nice. I wanted somethign else, but what i got i quite liked.

Had this from a growler courtesy of BrewerDan.
In fairness, this growler had been opened the previous day. Pours deep reddish orange, little head but respectable lacing. Nose - some pine and a strong citrus aroma, especially orange zest and some grapefruit. There is a good dose of bready, sweet malt evident, but nicely so. This is a well-balanced IPA, but maybe tilted toward the malts. Citrusy hops at the outset and in mildly dry finish. Carbonation seemed to fit, although lighter than expected. Mouthfeel was medium and creamy. The malt forward, almost no head, little observed carbonation, etc. were probably due to some lack of freshness but this was still an outstanding beer. I just hope I get to try it fresher next time (please?).

From my phone, so it is shortened.

Nice head, citrus aroma jumps off the glass before I can pick it up.
Head retention is nice, and lacing is smooth.  Taste is citrusy and
piney, but I notice that this is also extremely thin like the coconut
jack frost.  It has the consistancy of water.  The hops are prevalent, but have a feeling that they wouldnt hold up to a bottling.  Cant expect too much, as it is a session beer basically.

Huge huge thanks to Tharreld for the fresh growler!!!! It pours a beautiful amber color with a magnificent whipped cream like orangy head that lasts and lasts. The aroma is very earthy/woodsy with lots of candied hop flowers and grapefruit. The flavor is wonderfully balanced with lots of sweet candy and fruity flavors, mostly sugary grapefruit and touches of tropical goodness, pineapple, mango etc... There is a earthiness that brings it back to earth (pun intended) that just adds to the allure. And the potent bitter finish rounds this out to become one of the best IPAs Ive ever had the pleasure of tasting. Bravo!!!

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2011 Hop flavors are all over the place in this one, from the coldest opening sip to the last warm drop at the back of the palate.  Youve got a fantastic blend of citric flavors, particularly grapefruit rind, and grassy/floral hops.  I really enjoyed drinking this and finished my pint about as fast as I ever finish an IPA; terrific stuff, really drinkable, and an all-around excellent IPA.

Forgot to note: this is quite bitter, yet has no harshness.  My friend doesnt care for IPAs and said he liked the way the bitterness and citric flavors worked well together.

Sample from a growler.  Pours a clear faded copper color with a nice frothy beige head, nice lacing. Very interesting malts, some earthy and spicy hops with some biscuity malts. Pretty tasty, much different than expected. Seems much more like its English hopped.

Growler via trade with skinnyguy- thanks again, Dan!  Pours a deep orange-amber color with a creamy off-white head that sticks around for a while.  Aroma of floral hops, tropical fruits, orange and grapefruit citrus, pine, and tea leaves.  Flavor follows suit, and also shows some caramel malts, pine resin, and herbal notes.  Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a vegetal, somewhat resinous mouthfeel.  Very nice IPA that held up well in its growler trip to me.

From growler, courtesy of dpjuart. Just a phenomenal nose - one of the best hop aromas on a beer that Ive ever had. Perfect balance of citrus and grass. Medium dark amber-orange clear with pillowy off-white lacing head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Starts pretty dry with caramel and biscuit; tons of huge hops from the start to the finish. Great hop flavor with bitter but not harsh finish and after.

Trade from arminjewell.  Pours red with a huge, off white head.  Grapefruit, lemon, cherries, mild spicy notes.  Nice caramel backbone with a moderate bitter, and standout, juicy, mouth-puckering hop flavor of grapefruit and pine, finishing dry and resiny.  Wow.  Solid.

fresh ass growler courtesy of arminjewell, thanks a ton! i had a growler of this once before and it was different, it poured vary hazy, whereas this one pours a crisp amber. the nose is very sweet and fruity, lots of mango, caramalized banana, apricot, orange and ruby red grapefruit. lots of similar tastes, tons of ruby red with a bit of sugar on top like when i was a kid. yum! more candy notes cold, and a bit more bitterness at say 60f.

Lost the tasting notes for this one. Poured from growler received in trade. Aroma is not too strong, but is mostly citrus. Medium carbonation, flavor is also citrus and some maltiness. Missing a strong bitterness.

Growler from Town Hall.  Deep golden color with a few fingers of head, excellent lacing.  Amazing hoppy citrus aroma, flavor is more hops with a nice bitter bite.  Finish is dry & bitter with an off flavor that I cant quite identify.  Still a great beer.

Appearance: slightly hazy and bordering btw orange and amber, this IPA pours with a mousse like 3 finger foam head. Quite rocky, with good retention and CAKES of lacing! It would have got a 5.0 for appearance if the body wasnt so dark.

Smell: Not overpowering, but a beautiful bouquet of citrus hops and floral hops. Lots of pine sap, some grapefruit, and other citrus fruit notes.

Taste: Much like the nose with citrus fruit dominating the front and a slightly bitter hop finish.

Mouthfeel: fairly creamy and a medium body at most with a perfect amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Easy sipper!

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 12-11-2008
Nice to be able to stop by Town Hall Brewery on my way home from work!  The Masala Mama is my favorite - available at Town Hall either on tap or cask conditioned.

Pours a dark blood orange color and topped with a two-finger, creamy off-white head from the 64oz. growler courtesy of arminjewell (thanks, Armin): Nose of tropical fruits such as mango, pineapple, peaches, apricot, tangerine, orange, and lots of grapefruit bitters and pine needles. The taste is not as full as Id like, but still balanced and enjoyable. Medium-bodied, moderately to fully carbonated, crisp, clean, and fresh, even for its cross county trip in a growler. Lovely hop profile with a solid malt backing. Drinkability: Nothing really stands out, but I think its the overall feel of the IPA thats certainly enjoyable. I could drink this all day. Pairing: Fat delicious burger loaded with avocado, mango, and feta cheese. Rebuy: Yeah. #433 on 29042010, DG.

A- Body is a slightly translucent, dark rusty orange/amber color. Pours with a giant frothy, foamy off-white head. The growler was almost a gusher but stopped as soon as it reached the top and didnt overflow at all. Head eventually subsides to 1/2 finger and has perfect retention from there with lots of lacing left in the glass. When held up to the light one can see that it is nearly transparent with a very minimal uniform fogginess to the body.

S- Nose is deceptively sweet with a big presence of caramel malt being the highlight. Sweet citrus (grapefruit) hops arise next and there is just a touch of pine and earthiness also detectable. This doesnt have the scent of a big crazy West Coast hop bomb, but rather of a balanced IPA or red ale where the hops are definitely not the main character.

T-The flavor is huge all the way through. It begins with a balance of pine and citrus hop flavors upfront with a very substantial sweet caramel malt backbone. The finish starts out pretty sweet with the caramel malt coming through...just then a blast of pine flavor and bitterness comes through at the very end. What lingers is a medium residual piny bitterness along with a refreshing piny aftertaste.

P-Medium to high tingly carbonation with a very nice smooth oily body. Mouthfeel is light in weight.

O- This IPA is magnificent, brilliant! Minneapolis might just be the home of my favorite IPA. I love how the smell is so deceptively sweet then the flavor is like "just kidding-Im pretty much a hop bomb." Very pleased with this and happy that i have a whole growler of it to enjoy! (No one else around likes hoppy beers). This has the flavor of a DIPA packed into a regular IPA with a lower ABV. Wonderful indeed. Would have been the perfect beer if it just had a bit more citrus. It did land a spot in my all time top 10 favorite beers though!

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 01-07-2009 21:48:59

A top tier American IPA. This beer pours a rich amber with orange highlights. It has an excellent head and lots of lacing. Combination of hops, mostly floral and piney. Theres a touch of sweet citrus, but its a minor player compared to many IPAs. Underneath the hop aromas, theres an incredible and surprising maltiness. It has a fruity, nutty aroma and flavor that makes me think of an Amber Ale. The flavor is a tad dry and yeasty. The bitterness is extremely well-balanced, while maintaining a good hop bite.
RBWG 2010 growler. Pours clear orangish color with off white head. Grapefruit aroma. Bitter grapefruit and sweet tropical fruit flavors. Medium body with average carbonation.

Tap at the brewery.  I think this might have been mixed up with the new West Bank American Pale Ale which was magnificent.  The bartender assures me he didnt mix the two.  If thats the case, then the APA should be the featured brew here.  The glass that I have now that is supposedly the Masala Mamma has a bright copper pour and great lacing.  It has a medium hoppy nose.  Very piney taste and not as malty as the description would indicate.  Nice oily mouthfeel.

Growler: thanks to Greg, had at the March BA tasting- ended up drink easily a pint of this magic! .. lots of refined gentleman hops, nice malt backbone to hold its self together, and a clean and at the same time, sticky mouth! .. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0rVbFHPzc6k ... . I love every moment of this! ..reminded me of RR blind pig but with a slightly bigger nose..
Growler at RBWG. Dark copper pour. Huge citrus pine aroma with a nice malt balance. Smooth crisp malt with a nice citrus hop bite. Awesome..

Pour was dark golden amber with a finger white head. Aroma was of crisp fresh hops, citrus, and a little pine. Hop flavor was real strong and almost a little rough at times. Brew letft a little residual bitterness at the end which was nice. Good brew and would buy again

A: Poured from the growler to the glass to reveal a perfectly copper colored beer with a fluffy off-white head.

S: Lots of great grapefruit and pine aromas fill the nose. There is also a hint of sweet tropical fruit, such as pineapple and mango, on the finish.

T: The same great fruits that were present in the aroma are picked up on the tongue as well, but perhaps not quite as intense. There is also a nice bitterness on the finish.

M: Despite the long trip in the growler, this beer was still very well carbonated. A nice medium body on this beer.

D: This is definitely one of the more hoppy and aromatic IPAs that Ive had from outside California. A very easy drinking, one, however. And at 5.9% ABV, its not too tough to have a few glasses of.
Thanks a Million to DalzeAle for this awesome beer (Growler). Huge hops upfront with a good deal of malt.  taste was clean and fresh .  Would like to get more from Town Hall.  Thanks again Greg.
Pours golden with orange tint.  Wispy off-white head.  Nose of tropical fruits, citrus, some resin.  Just a lovely hop profile and a solid bit of malt to back it up.  Lovely and fresh.  Yum.

I was seriously amazed by this beer. Tasted on tap at the Town Hall brewery, I got a sampler and this one stood out. Great IPA, nice amber appearance with a hue of orange, can smell the centennial and cascade right away. Nice fruity taste. Overall a pretty solid and drinkable IPA

Pours a translucent gold with a one finger white head. The nose is fruity and citrusy, huge hop profile, resinous, mango, overripe fruit. Flavor is fruity and citrusy, resinous, a bit off. Palate is mild on the bitterness.

On tap at the brewpub. Poured a clear amber with a slight orange hue. The head was white and laced very nicely. Aroma was mainly piney hops with an undertone of grainy malts. Flavor was full of pine hops with an undertone of citrus and malts.

Courtesy of tytoanderso via trade
Growler:  The aroma consists of mango, sweet orange, caramel, and grapefruit.  It pours a transparent amber with a large off-white head and excellent retention and great webbing for lacing.  I really dont think you could expect anything more in the appearance of an IPA.  The flavor starts with some tropical fruitiness and caramel.  The finish has moderate grapefruit and a hint of pine.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.  This goes down way too easy.  This would definitely enter my rotation of "go to" IPAs if it was bottled and available in Michigan.

Pours a cloudy orange with a rich foamy head. Aroma of citrus and grapefruit. Flavor is quite bitter with a heavy dose of citrus and floral hops and some malty qualities as well. Medium bodied with medium carbination. Bitter hop finish. Great IPA.

Thanks to ArminJewell

Appearance:  Pours a slightly hazy, otherwise clear amber with visible carbonation. The head is awesome, a thick beautiful cream colored cap.

Aroma: Grapefruit, pine,brown sugar, and floral perfume.

Taste: Resiny pine, big bitter hops, spicy malt, and slight citrus zest. The flavor starts out bit but levels out to nothing shortly after the sip.

Mouthfeel: Very carbonated, low to medium bodied. Im guessing town hall is hip to growlers being hoarded or shipped out of state, and they are over compensating on the bubbles due to that fact.

Overall:  A flavorful, bold IPA from Minnesota. Id be very happy to drink that every day if I was out there. Its a nice representation of a West Coast IPA, highly drinkable, and fairly priced. Thanks Armin!
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2010 Delicious IPA with crisp with hoppy spice notes. Citrus notes and a nice bubbly head make this a very likeable IPA.

On tap, at brewpub.  Pours a slightly hazy orangish gold body with a nice frothy white head that left some sticky lacing.  Huge citrusy grapefruity hop nose with some light tangerine and a fairly restrained malt character that lets the hops take center stage.  Big bitterness on the flavor with a nice balance between floral and citrusy hoppiness.  The finish lingers on for a good long while, leaving you wanting another sip before it fades away.  Medium bodied with a bit of resiny stickiness and moderate fizzy carbonation.  A very nice IPA, deserving of its reputation.

Growler, this was the first IPA that i called my favorite IPA.  Pours an orange golden body with a white head.  Fresh citrus, tangerines and a lovely floral hop tones.  In better than perfect balance with domineering hop tones, pine y fresh hoppiness and a sweet citrus finish.  Phenomenal.

Growler thanks to bret27.   Copper colored with a lasting white head.   The aroma has a nice spread of fruity hops: peach, pineapple, citrus.   There is also a sweet floral side and a hint of caramel.   The flavor is mild on the bitterness, which is a little more apparent than IBU numbers might suggest due to a strong bready, crackery malt side.   Fruity and floral hop flavors blend in pretty well, creating a pretty balanced overall package.   Lighter in body with smooth carbonation.   Lots of malt flavors for an IPA, with just enough hops to balance them out, but it is not a sweet beer, adding to a very drinkable, almost session-like presentation for the style.   I would peg this more like a hoppy pale ale, but a fun beer with an interesting mix of flavors for the style.
Poured from growler, copper in color with a medium white head.  Nose was citrus, pine,hops;  Beer was smooth, nicely balanced in taste, bitter, yet a little sweet, medium bodied.  Good IPA.

Growler (thanks to Tweety for sharing this)...  Poured a nice amberish, hazy orange with a thick, beige head.  Solid, balanced IPA with a subtly, soft carbonation, low bitterness, musty, earth-like hops and a buttery malt balance.

The Dan Journal #292.  Tasted 9/10/09.  Growler bottled and purchased 9/3/09.  Thanks Keir!  Mildly hazy with a golden hue.  Ring of lacing bone white head.  Bright hoppy aromas with hints of citrus.  Touch perfumy and peppery.  Full bodied beer.  Multi-layered hop palate.  Earthy and resinous.  Big palate with lingering flavors.  Totally tasty.

Cask. RBSG 07. Clear amber, lasting white head. Fresh, floral, lightly skunky and resinous hops, a bit spicy. Lightly sweet pale malt background. Medium, cask level carbonation. Easy drinking. From notes.

Quite a pleasant beer. The bartender made sure to mention this is their most popular style. Deep golden amber color with a small head, aroma has strong floral and citrus tones. Huge grapefruit flavor, definite citrus. Sits quick on the tongue and fades nicely. Very drinkable.

Growler from my fatasy baseball league victory... Thanks Cory from BeerAdvocate. Had this one sit in my fridge for 3 weeks. Finally bust it out for my bachlor party. Still damn good after the 3 weeks. Poured a hazy amber color with nice fluffy head, and good lacing. Smell of strong ass grapefruit (just the way I like it), hops and more hops. Taste is similar, very smooth drinking this, kinda didnt want to share it but I did. This is a well balance IPA. They should consider bottling this and making money off this gem. Im number 300 for this beer, kick ass!

Growler from trade with skinnyguy-  Thanks Dan!  Pours a clear copper with a huge crater tan head.  awesome lace.  Aroma of citrusy hops, grapefruit, pine, orange peel, toffee.  Flavor is bitter grapefruit rinds, toast, caramel, a hint of alcohol.  An all around great IPA.  very well balanced and drinkable.  Awesome beer!

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2011 Cask pour into Pint Glass.

Hazy reddish-orange, thin head but considerable lacing. Love the way the cask pour looks as it settles, which took a couple minutes.

Aroma of citrus, pine and bitterness. Very slight malt presence, but not much.

Similar to smell - citrus, pine and very bitter. Small malt presence leading to a soft sweet counterbalance. However, the malts dont provide too much balance, this is an especially bitter IPA.

Expected feel for a cask beer, which is wonderful. Very, very dry.

Strong drinkability due to how smooth it is, but the persistent bitterness limits my intake.

On tap at the pub.
Clear and crisp looking - nice reddish hue through the glass. Moderate head and a very nice mix of hop citrus and floral aromas that dont overwhelm you senses. Good balance of malt and bitterness and hops. I like this beer a lot.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2009 Growler pours a dark copper with a hint of red and a nice creamy head.  Aroma is heavy on the citrus hops.  Taste is immediately citrus, then a honey sweetness, then a wave of bitterness from the hops.  Medium bodied with a long lasting hop presence on your tongue.  Masala Mama may be too much for those who dont like bitter beers, but it is really an excellent IPA.

Rich copper color with a large, creamy beige head.  Pungent aroma of citrus, grapefruit, florals, and pure hoppy goodness.  Smooth and rich hoppy taste is again full of citrus and florals, some grapefruit and resin.  Mild malt backer.  Very nice.

Tap @ MTHB - Pours deep copper with a small cream-colored head. Smell is a blast of fresh, citrusy hops. Not overwhelming, but pretty one-note nonetheless. Theres also a bit of fruit in there--maybe melon? Taste is the same citrus hops with a bit of dryness. Finishes with a nice malt balance, along with some chocolate notes. Too much carbonation, but nice and resiny while feeling very crisp. Nicely done, but not the experience I had hoped for.

Growler from maximum12 off BA site.  Shared at the Houston BA Tasting in October.  Pours a clear amber with a nice white head.  Nose is of grass, pine and citrus.  Taste is the same grass, pine and citrus.  A bit earthy as well.  Very nice.  Mouthfeel is crisp and clean and has a good bitter finish.

Growler from JW77...the man! Pours an orangish color with a fluffy head.  Aroma is full of every imaginable hop: floral, pine, tropical fruit, earthy, grassy.  Great malt too.  Flavor is so smooth with all the hop goodness you could want without crazy bitterness.  Jesus this is good stuff.

On tap at the brewery.  I saw this being poured from across the bar and it is just one of the best looking beers you will ever see.  Pours a bright orange/copper color.  Medium head that dissipates but leaves good lacing all the way.  Aroma is grapefruit hops.  Taste is also citrus hops with some pine.  Great.  Absolutely loved this beer.  One of the best, freshest and crisp IPAs I have had.  Good stuff.  Also, the ABV was low which I found surpising for an IPA that tasted this good.

Growler from ty, thanks brother!  Big rocky head, nice orange color. Nice nose... Taste is nice as well...Not overdone or underdone. Just a nice bitterness to it. All the hops are blended well together. Medium texture. Easy drinking.....Overall...This growler was about a week old, I wish I could have it straight from the brewery but this was still good.

On tap at the brewpub.Pours a clear rich copper with long-lasting foamy white head that lines the glass with lots of lace as you drink it down. Aroma packs your standard bitter American-IPA notes of pine and grapefruity citrus. Surprise, flavor shows the same and with good sweetness to back it all up. Not the most well-balanced combination of flavors but its still pretty good. Strangely smooth palate. Pretty good.

Tap and cask at brewery on 09.04.09; growler on 09.10.09.  Pours copper with a thick, creamy head.  Nose full of citrus, floral, and pine.  Huge flavor of citrus and pine.  More earthy from the cask.  Too cold from the tap.  Tasty from the growler.

growler - thanks BVC!! pours glowing, dark copper with thick white head; sweet, malty aromas and hops hit at first sip; spicy and sweet hops create a very bitter and dry finish; some garlic flavors in there too; tons of flavor with earthy, grainy hop texture; raw and hoppy; great stuff indeed; thanks brandon!!
ping at the brewery - Aroma has a huge citrus pine resin start with a chewy caramel finish.  Flavor matches.  Palate is tart and creamy.  A damn super tasty chewy IPA.

A dark amber pour, with a dense creamy tan head that lasts a while. Floral hop aroma with a bouquet or amarillo, cascade and centenial? Delicious ipa flavor, very sweet and creamy, and floral. 100% satisfying. Heavy lacing. Nice malty backend if you can find it through the hops.

Pours a beautiful copper with very active carbonation in my Sam Adams sensory glass. The head is of white and thick - and has stuck around quote a while. 

Scent is very citrusy hops with a hint of pine. Very sweet in the nose and quite profound a character for a single ipa. 

Taste is also quite distinctive for a regular ipa. Very smooth bit still citrus bitter, no sign of alcohol. This is an ipa lovers ipa. 

Mouth is medium both in carbonation and body. 

Extremely drinkable.. Shame to have to finish this growler myself, but at least that wont be an issue. Is this the best regular ipa? Probably, at least of those I have had. Does it belong in the top 20? I dont know that by definition any ipa couldnmeet that standard, but certai my as of pertains to style, this is the head of its class.

Growler acquired via a trade with tennisjoel (HUGE thanks for this one).  Pours dark orange with a creamy off-white head.  Big citrusy and floral hop aromas.  Bitter grapefruit flavor.  This is an excellent IPA with big hop flavor not usually found in a single IPA, especially one with a low ABV.  I wish this were easier to obtain; it is excellent.

growler sample poured an amber in color with a white head that laced nicely on the glass. aroma smacks of hops, grass, citrus, resins, and caramel malt. flavor has even better hop character than the nose. citrus, pine resins, grapefruit, light bitterness, caramel malt, just the right sweetness, and it hangs on your tongue for a long while. wow was this one yummy, have to try this one again!
Pours clear copper with a thin cream colored head.Mostly grassy hops in the nose and flavor. Dry, clean finish.

Growler shared by Hophead22.. Pours a orange copper with a white head.. Lots of citrus and floral hops, very nice aroma.. Sweet citrus hops with some lingering grapefruit bitterness.. Nice beer, Thanks Tim

Tap and cask at the brewery. Dark copperish color with a very light tan head. Very nice hop aroma, piney, very nice. Very clean hop character, more pine, very well balanced with some caramelly maltiness in there. Had a nice lingering aftertaste, very good.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Growler from tytoanderso, shared at Lost Abbey. Pours with a creamy tan head and a hazy bronze body. Aroma is clean with a ton of pine. Taste is pine and caramel with a lot of residual uneaten sugar. Light bubbles creamy carbonation. Not the worlds best IPA, but very good.

Growler.  Pours amber with a nice white head.  Smells of pineapple, grapefruit, sweet oranges, some peppery hints, spicy.  Tastes of pronounced citrus, pepper, spice, some caramel, great peppery bitterness on the finish.
Well balanced IPA. Some sticky and sweetness. Taste of fruit. Orange hue. Enjoyable.

Growler pour at RBSG Grad Tasting 09.  Smells of peppery hops, tart malt and mineral water.  Flavor puts a huge vaporous hopping on your tongue like the effect of Drakes 1500.  Body is a big tart malty bite that avoids biscuity very well.  Sort of absent on fruit, and feels bigger than 6%.

Growler at PPRBSG09. Orange pour waith creamy white head and lace. Very evergreen/grapefruit aroma. Apples caramel malt and a very nice finishing bitter. An evergreen/citrus flavor as well. Medium bodied with damn good carbonation.

Original review date 5/30/2009...

Growler with BBD 6/4 . Poured into the Duvel tulip...cap pops with a nice little fizz....

Pours a honey/butterscotch/copper/bourbon color with a sourdough/eggshell head - about 1 finger that drops down to about ½. Decent lacing...a little chill haze on the body. Sparse carbonation rises with moderate speed.

Lots of hops...Nugget/Amarillo/Chinook? I dunno, but its fresh and absolutely wonderful. Very nice bitterness here. Quite subtle, but quite clean. Malt is there too - a little spicy caramel here. Light-bodied and very enjoyable.

This is a little different.
